paragraphs.content: Chapter 26
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 26

paragraphs.content: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

paragraphs.content: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

paragraphs.content: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

paragraphs.content: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

paragraphs.content: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

paragraphs.content: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

paragraphs.content: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

paragraphs.content: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

paragraphs.content: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

paragraphs.content: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

paragraphs.content: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

paragraphs.content: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

paragraphs.content: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

paragraphs.content: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

paragraphs.content: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

paragraphs.content: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

paragraphs.content: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

paragraphs.content: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

paragraphs.content: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
paragraphs.contentHtml: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

paragraphs.content: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

paragraphs.content: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

paragraphs.content: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

paragraphs.content: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

paragraphs.content: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

paragraphs.content: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

paragraphs.content: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.

paragraphs.content: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

paragraphs.content: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
